result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole Ryan Lamb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
BOND TO BE APPLIED

PP $50.00 PER MONTH COMMENCING FEBRUARY 15, 2016 AND ON THE 15TH DAY OF EACH MONTH THEREAFTER

Defendant does not appear and no attorney appears on behalf of defendant.  Court holds defendant in contempt.
Report to Jail- April 1, 2016 by 6 p.m.
Defendant called -- not working.  Will make first payment by March 15, 2016.   Wondered if couch surfing would qualify for a lower payment!

Defendant appears via VTC with Attorney Fudge.  Court orders $500 Cash Bond with conditions.

Curfew 6pm-6am, except for work purposes, treatment purposes, NA or AA, as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program.
